name.title: Name of the application
name.description: The application name. Only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens (-) are allowed. The name must start and end with a letter or number.

resourceGroup.title: Name of the Azure resource group
resourceGroup.description: When specified will override the resource group name used for infrastructure provisioning. Supports environment variable substitution.

template.title: Identifier of the template from which the application was created. Optional.

infra.title: The infrastructure configuration used for the application
infra.description: Optional. Provides additional configuration for Azure infrastructure provisioning.

provider.title: Type of infrastructure provisioning provider
provider.description: Optional. The infrastructure provisioning provider used to provision the Azure resources for the application. (Default: bicep)

path.title: Path to the location that contains Azure provisioning templates
path.description: Optional. The relative folder path to the Azure provisioning templates for the specified provider. (Default: infra)

module.title: Name of the default module within the Azure provisioning templates
module.description: Optional. The name of the Azure provisioning module used when provisioning resources. (Default: main)

services.title: Definition of services that comprise the application

apiVersion.title: Resource provider API version for deployments
apiVersion.description: Optional. The resource provider API version to use for the service. If not specified, the default SDK API version is used. Only valid when host is 'containerapp'.

resourceGroup.title: Name of the Azure resource group that contains the resource
resourceGroup.description: By default, the CLI will discover the Azure resource within the default resource group. When specified, the CLI will instead find the Azure resource within the specified resource group. Supports environment variable substitution.

resourceName.title: Name of the Azure resource that implements the service
resourceName.description: By default, the CLI will discover the Azure resource with tag 'azd-service-name' set to the current service's name. When specified, the CLI will instead find the Azure resource with the matching resource name. Supports environment variable substitution.

project.title: Path to the service source code directory

image.title: Optional. The source image to be used for the container image instead of building from source. Supports environment variable substitution.
image.description: If omitted, container image will be built from source specified in the 'project' property. Setting both 'project' and 'image' is invalid.

host.title: Required. The type of Azure resource used for service implementation
host.description: The Azure service that will be used as the target for deployment operations for the service.

module.title: Path of the infrastructure module used to deploy the service relative to the root infra folder
module.description: If omitted, the CLI will assume the module name is the same as the service name.

dist.title: Relative path to service deployment artifacts

uses.title: Dependencies on other services and resources
uses.description: List of service names and resource names that this service depends on.

env.title: Environment variables for the service
env.description: Optional. A map of environment variable names to values. Supports environment variable substitution.

hooks.title: Service level hooks
hooks.description: Hooks should match `service` event names prefixed with `pre` or `post` depending on when the script should execute. When specifying paths they should be relative to the service path.

predeploy.title: pre deploy hook
predeploy.description: Runs before the service is deployed to Azure

postdeploy.title: post deploy hook
postdeploy.description: Runs after the service is deployed to Azure

prerestore.title: pre restore hook
prerestore.description: Runs before the service dependencies are restored

postrestore.title: post restore hook
postrestore.description: Runs after the service dependencies are restored

prebuild.title: pre build hook
prebuild.description: Runs before the service is built

postbuild.title: post build hook
postbuild.description: Runs after the service is built

prepackage.title: pre package hook
prepackage.description: Runs before the service is deployment package is created

postpackage.title: post package hook
postpackage.description: Runs after the service is deployment package is created

prepublish.title: pre publish hook
prepublish.description: Runs before the service is published

postpublish.title: post publish hook
postpublish.description: Runs after the service is published

allOf.comment: ContainerApp host - supports image OR project, docker config, and apiVersion
AKS host - project is optional, supports docker and k8s config
AI Endpoint host - requires project and config, supports docker

config.title: The Azure AI endpoint configuration.
config.description: Required. Provides additional configuration for Azure AI online endpoint deployment.

allOf.comment: Azure AI Agent host - requires project, supports docker and config

config.title: The Azure AI Agent configuration.
config.description: Optional. Provides additional configuration for Azure AI Agent deployment.

allOf.comment: Traditional hosts - require project only, disable container-specific properties

type.title: Type of resource
type.description: The type of resource to be created. (Example: db.postgres)

uses.title: Other resources that this resource uses

existing.title: An existing resource for referencing purposes
existing.description: Optional. When set to true, this resource will not be created and instead be used for referencing purposes. (Default: false)

provider.title: Type of pipeline provider
provider.description: Optional. The pipeline provider to be used for continuous integration. (Default: github)

variables.title: Optional. List of azd environment variables to be used in the pipeline as variables.
variables.description: If variable is found on azd environment, it is set as a variable for the pipeline.

secrets.title: Optional. List of azd environment variables to be used in the pipeline as secrets.
secrets.description: If variable is found on azd environment, it is set as a secret for the pipeline.

hooks.title: Command level hooks
hooks.description: Hooks should match `azd` command names prefixed with `pre` or `post` depending on when the script should execute. When specifying paths they should be relative to the project path.

preinfracreate.title: pre infra create hook
preinfracreate.description: Runs before the `infra create` or `provision` commands

postinfracreate.title: post infra create hook
postinfracreate.description: Runs after the `infra create` or `provision` commands

preinfradelete.title: pre infra delete hook
preinfradelete.description: Runs before the `infra delete` or `down` commands

postinfradelete.title: post infra delete hook
postinfradelete.description: Runs after the `infra delete` or `down` commands

predown.title: pre down hook
predown.description: Runs before the `infra delete` or `down` commands

postdown.title: post down hook
postdown.description: Runs after the `infra delete` or `down` commands

requiredVersions.description: Optional. Provides additional configuration for required versions of `azd` and extensions.

azd.title: A range of supported versions of `azd` for this project
azd.description: A range of supported versions of `azd` for this project. If the version of `azd` is outside this range, the project will fail to load. Optional (allows all versions if absent).

extensions.title: A map of required extensions and version constraints for this project.
extensions.description: A map of required extensions and version constraints for this project. Supports semver constraints. If version is omitted the latest version will be installed.

state.title: The state configuration used for the project.
state.description: Optional. Provides additional configuration for state management.

remote.title: The remote state configuration.
remote.description: Optional. Provides additional configuration for remote state management such as Azure Blob Storage.

backend.title: The remote state backend type.
backend.description: Optional. The remote state backend type. (Default: AzureBlobStorage)

platform.title: The platform configuration used for the project.
platform.description: Optional. Provides additional configuration for platform specific features such as Azure Dev Center.

workflows.title: The workflows configuration used for the project.
workflows.description: Optional. Provides additional configuration for workflows such as override azd up behavior.

up.title: The up workflow configuration
up.description: When specified will override the default behavior for the azd up workflow. Common use cases include changing the order of the provision, package and deploy commands.

cloud.title: The cloud configuration used for the project.
cloud.description: Optional. Provides additional configuration for deploying to sovereign clouds such as Azure Government. The default cloud is AzureCloud.

shell.title: Type of shell to execute scripts
shell.description: Optional. The type of shell to use for the hook. (Default: sh)

run.title: Required. The inline script or relative path of your scripts from the project or service path
run.description: When specifying an inline script you also must specify the `shell` to use. This is automatically inferred when using paths.

continueOnError.title: Whether or not a script error will halt the azd command
continueOnError.description: Optional. When set to true will continue to run the command even after a script error has occurred. (Default: false)

interactive.title: Whether the script will run in interactive mode
interactive.description: Optional. When set to true will bind the script to stdin, stdout & stderr of the running console. (Default: false)

windows.title: The hook configuration used for Windows environments
windows.description: When specified overrides the hook configuration when executed in Windows environments

posix.title: The hook configuration used for POSIX (Linux & MacOS) environments
posix.description: When specified overrides the hook configuration when executed in POSIX environments

secrets.title: Optional. Map of azd environment variables to hook secrets.
secrets.description: If variable was set as a secret in the environment, the secret value will be passed to the hook.

docker.description: This is only applicable for hosts that support containers

path.title: The path to the Dockerfile
path.description: Path to the Dockerfile is relative to your service

context.title: The docker build context
context.description: When specified overrides the default context

registry.title: Optional. The container registry to push the image to.
registry.description: If omitted, will default to value of AZURE_CONTAINER_REGISTRY_ENDPOINT environment variable. Supports environment variable substitution.

image.title: Optional. The name that will be applied to the built container image.
image.description: If omitted, will default to the '{appName}/{serviceName}-{environmentName}'. Supports environment variable substitution.

tag.title: The tag that will be applied to the built container image.
tag.description: If omitted, will default to 'azd-deploy-{unix time (seconds)}'. Supports environment variable substitution. For example, to generate unique tags for a given release: myapp/myimage:${DOCKER_IMAGE_TAG}

buildArgs.title: Optional. Build arguments to pass to the docker build command
buildArgs.description: Build arguments to pass to the docker build command.

remoteBuild.title: Optional. Whether to build the image remotely
remoteBuild.description: If set to true, the image will be built remotely using the Azure Container Registry remote build feature. If set to false, the image will be built locally using Docker.

aksOptions.title: Optional. The Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) configuration options

deploymentPath.title: Optional. The relative path from the service path to the k8s deployment manifests. (Default: manifests)
deploymentPath.description: When set it will override the default deployment path location for k8s deployment manifests.

namespace.title: Optional. The k8s namespace of the deployed resources. (Default: Project name)
namespace.description: When specified a new k8s namespace will be created if it does not already exist

name.title: Optional. The name of the k8s deployment resource to use during deployment. (Default: Service name)
name.description: Used during deployment to ensure if the k8s deployment rollout has been completed. If not set will search for a deployment resource in the same namespace that contains the service name.

name.title: Optional. The name of the k8s service resource to use as the default service endpoint. (Default: Service name)
name.description: Used when determining endpoints for the default service resource. If not set will search for a deployment resource in the same namespace that contains the service name.

name.title: Optional. The name of the k8s ingress resource to use as the default service endpoint. (Default: Service name)
name.description: Used when determining endpoints for the default ingress resource. If not set will search for a deployment resource in the same namespace that contains the service name.

relativePath.title: Optional. The relative path to the service from the root of your ingress controller.
relativePath.description: When set will be appended to the root of your ingress resource path.

repositories.title: Optional. The helm repositories to add
repositories.description: When set will add the helm repositories to the helm client.

name.title: The name of the helm repository
name.description: The name of the helm repository to add.

url.title: The url of the helm repository
url.description: The url of the helm repository to add.

releases.title: Optional. The helm releases to install
releases.description: When set will install the helm releases to the k8s cluster.

name.title: The name of the helm release
name.description: The name of the helm release to install.

chart.title: The name of the helm chart
chart.description: The name of the helm chart to install.

version.title: The version of the helm chart
version.description: The version of the helm chart to install.

namespace.title: Optional. The k8s namespace to install the helm chart
namespace.description: When set will install the helm chart to the specified namespace. Defaults to the service namespace.

values.title: Optional. Relative path from service to a values.yaml to pass to the helm chart
values.description: When set will pass the values to the helm chart.

dir.title: Optional. The relative path to the kustomize directory.
dir.description: When set will use the kustomize directory to deploy to the k8s cluster. Supports environment variable substitution.

edits.title: Optional. The kustomize edits to apply before deployment.
edits.description: When set will apply the edits to the kustomize directory before deployment. Supports environment variable substitution.

env.title: Optional. The environment key/value pairs used to generate a .env file.
env.description: When set will generate a .env file in the kustomize directory. Values support environment variable substitution.

azureBlobStorageConfig.title: The Azure Blob Storage remote state backend configuration.
azureBlobStorageConfig.description: Optional. Provides additional configuration for remote state management such as Azure Blob Storage.

accountName.title: The Azure Storage account name.
accountName.description: Required. The Azure Storage account name.

containerName.title: The Azure Storage container name.
containerName.description: Optional. The Azure Storage container name. Defaults to project name if not specified.

endpoint.title: The Azure Storage endpoint.
endpoint.description: Optional. The Azure Storage endpoint. (Default: blob.core.windows.net)

azureDevCenterConfig.title: The dev center configuration used for the project.
azureDevCenterConfig.description: Optional. Provides additional project configuration for Azure Dev Center integration.

name.title: The name of the Azure Dev Center
name.description: Optional. Used as the default dev center for this project.

project.title: The name of the Azure Dev Center project.
project.description: Optional. Used as the default dev center project for this project.

catalog.title: The name of the Azure Dev Center catalog.
catalog.description: Optional. Used as the default dev center catalog for this project.

environmentDefinition.title: The name of the Dev Center catalog environment definition.
environmentDefinition.description: Optional. Used as the default dev center environment definition for this project.

environmentType.title: The Dev Center project environment type used for the deployment environment.
environmentType.description: Optional. Used as the default environment type for this project.

steps.title: The steps to execute in the workflow
steps.description: The steps to execute in the workflow. (Example: provision, package, deploy)

azd.title: The azd command command configuration
azd.description: The azd command configuration to execute. (Example: up)

anyOf.title: The azd command to execute
anyOf.description: The name and args of the azd command to execute. (Example: deploy --all)

args.title: The arguments or flags to pass to the azd command
args.description: The arguments to pass to the azd command. (Example: --all)

name.title: Name of the AI component.
name.description: Optional. When omitted AZD will generate a name based on the component type and the service name. Supports environment variable substitution.

path.title: Path to the AI component configuration file or path.
path.description: Required. The path to the AI component configuration file or path to the AI component source code.

overrides.title: A map of key value pairs used to override the AI component configuration.

environment.title: A map of key/value pairs to set as environment variables for the deployment.
environment.description: Optional. Values support OS & AZD environment variable substitution.

workspace.title: The name of the AI Studio project workspace.
workspace.description: Optional. When omitted AZD will use the value specified in the 'AZUREAI_PROJECT_NAME' environment variable. Supports environment variable substitution.

flow.title: The Azure AI Studio Prompt Flow configuration.
flow.description: Optional. When omitted a prompt flow will be not created.

environment.title: The Azure AI Studio custom environment configuration.
environment.description: Optional. When omitted a custom environment will not be created.

model.title: The Azure AI Studio model configuration.
model.description: Optional. When omitted a model will not be created.

deployment.title: The Azure AI Studio online endpoint deployment configuration.
deployment.description: Required. A new online endpoint deployment will be created and traffic will automatically to shifted to the new deployment upon successful completion.

appServiceResource.description: An Azure App Service web app.

uses.title: Other resources that this resource uses

port.title: Port that the web app listens on
port.description: Optional. The port that the web app listens on. (Default: 80)

env.title: Environment variables to set for the web app

value.title: Value of the environment variable. Supports environment variable substitution.

secret.title: Secret value of the environment variable. Supports environment variable substitution.

runtime.title: Runtime stack configuration
runtime.description: Required. The language runtime configuration for the App Service web app.

version.title: Runtime stack version
version.description: Required. The language runtime version. Format varies by stack. (Example: '22-lts' for Node, '3.13' for Python)

startupCommand.title: Startup command
startupCommand.description: Optional. Startup command that will be run as part of web app startup.

port.title: Port that the container app listens on
port.description: Optional. The port that the container app listens on. (Default: 80)

env.title: Environment variables to set for the container app

value.title: Value of the environment variable. Supports environment variable substitution.

secret.title: Secret value of the environment variable. Supports environment variable substitution.

existing.description: Optional. When set to true, this resource will not be created and instead be used for referencing purposes. (Default: false)

name.title: The name of the AI model.
name.description: Required. The name of the AI model.

version.title: The version of the AI model.

models.title: AI models to deploy
models.description: Optional. The AI models to be deployed as part of the AI project.

name.title: The name of the AI model.
name.description: Required. The name of the AI model.

version.title: The version of the AI model.
version.description: Required. The version of the AI model.

format.title: The format of the AI model.
format.description: Required. The format of the AI model. (Example: Microsoft, OpenAI)

sku.title: The SKU configuration for the AI model.
sku.description: Required. The SKU details for the AI model.

name.title: The name of the SKU.
name.description: Required. The name of the SKU. (Example: GlobalStandard)

usageName.title: The usage name of the SKU.
usageName.description: Required. The usage name of the SKU for billing purposes. (Example: AIServices.GlobalStandard.MaaS, OpenAI.GlobalStandard.gpt-4o-mini)

capacity.title: The capacity of the SKU.
capacity.description: Required. The capacity of the SKU.

containers.description: Containers to be created to store data. Each container stores a collection of items.

name.title: Container name.
name.description: Required. The name of the container.

partitionKeys.title: Partition keys.
partitionKeys.description: Required. The partition key(s) used to distribute data across partitions. The ordering of keys matters. By default, a single partition key '/id' is naturally a great choice for most applications.

hubs.title: Hubs to create in the Event Hubs namespace

queues.title: Queues to create in the Service Bus namespace

topics.title: Topics to create in the Service Bus namespace

items.title: Azure Storage Account container name
items.description: The container name of Azure Storage Account.
